original: In the not-so-distant future, a peculiar phenomenon gripped the world. It started with a simple realization: every time an individual experienced pain, that pain never dissipated. Instead, it accumulated, persisting long after the initial discomfort had subsided. People soon discovered that if they stubbed their toe, for instance, it would remain perpetually stubbed.
